alert.note: Alert for Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 3:10PM EDT until July 27 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of western Massachusetts and east central New York, including the following counties, in western Massachusetts, Berkshire. In east central New York, Columbia, Dutchess and Ulster. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Great Barrington, Saugerties, Lee, Woodstock, Livingston, Copake, Clermont, Red Hook, Housatonic, Saugerties South, Lake Katrine, Veteran, Germantown, Stockbridge, Hillsdale, Taghkanic, Tivoli, Centerville, Washington and Alford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
